Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: fly
Description: The flyctl is a command-line interface for fly.io

Arguments.Name: agent
Arguments.Description: Commands that manage the Fly agent, a background process that manages flyctl wireguard connections

Arguments.Name: daemon-start
Arguments.Description: Run the Fly agent in the foreground

Arguments.Name: --generate-name
Arguments.Description: Generate a name for the app

Arguments.Name: move
Arguments.Description: Move an app to another organization

Arguments.Name: open
Arguments.Description: Open browser to current deployed application

Arguments.Name: --image
Arguments.Description: Display the Docker image reference of the release

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Will issue a restart against each Machine even if there are errors. ( Machines only )

Arguments.Name: --skip-health-checks
Arguments.Description: Restarts app without waiting for health checks. ( Machines only )

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Log in with an email and password interactively

Arguments.Name: logout
Arguments.Description: Logs out the currently logged in user

Arguments.Name: whoami
Arguments.Description: Displays the users email address/service identity currently authenticated and in use

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to an app config file or directory containing one

Arguments.Description: Configure a traffic balanced app with params (min=int max=int)

Arguments.Name: --config

Arguments.Name: --build-arg
Arguments.Description: Set of build time variables in the form of NAME=VALUE pairs. Can be specified multiple times

Arguments.Name: --build-target
Arguments.Description: Set the target build stage to build if the Dockerfile has more than one stage

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Return immediately instead of monitoring deployment progress

Arguments.Name: --dockerfile
Arguments.Description: Path to a Dockerfile. Defaults to the Dockerfile in the working directory

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: Set of environment variables in the form of NAME=VALUE pairs. Can be specified multiple times

Arguments.Name: --image
Arguments.Description: The image tag or ID to deploy

Arguments.Name: --image-label
Arguments.Description: Image label to use when tagging and pushing to the fly registry. Defaults to "deployment-{timestamp}"

Arguments.Name: --local-only
Arguments.Description: Only perform builds locally using the local docker daemon

Arguments.Name: --no-cache
Arguments.Description: Do not use the build cache when building the image

Arguments.Name: --push
Arguments.Description: Push image to registry after build is complete

Arguments.Name: --remote-only
Arguments.Description: Perform builds on a remote builder instance instead of using the local docker daemon

Arguments.Name: --strategy
Arguments.Description: The strategy for replacing running instances. Options are canary, rolling, bluegreen, or immediate. Default is canary, or rolling when max-per-region is set

Arguments.Name: dig
Arguments.Description: Make DNS requests against Fly.io's internal DNS server

Arguments.Name: --short
Arguments.Description: Just print the answers, not DNS record details

Arguments.Name: doctor
Arguments.Description: The DOCTOR command allows you to debug your Fly environment

Arguments.Name: diag
Arguments.Description: Send diagnostic information about your applications back to Fly.io

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Send diagnostics even if we can't find your local Fly.io app

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates the app's image to the latest available version. (Fly Postgres only)

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Return immediately instead of monitoring update progress

Arguments.Description: Path to an app config file or directory containing one

Arguments.Description: Kind of CPU to use (shared, dedicated)

Arguments.Name: --dockerfile
Arguments.Description: Path to a Dockerfile. Defaults to the Dockerfile in the working directory

Arguments.Name: --env

Arguments.Name: --image-label

Arguments.Name: --memory
Arguments.Description: Memory (in megabytes) to attribute to the machine

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Machine name, will be generated if missing

Arguments.Name: --no-build-cache
Arguments.Description: Do not use the cache when building the image

Arguments.Name: --org
Arguments.Description: The organization that will own the app

Arguments.Name: --size
Arguments.Description: Preset guest cpu and memory for a machine

Arguments.Name: --volume
Arguments.Description: Volumes to mount in the form of <volume_id_or_name>:/path/inside/machine[:<options>]

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Show current status of a running machine

Arguments.Name: --signal
Arguments.Description: Signal to stop the machine with (default: SIGINT)

Arguments.Name: --time
Arguments.Description: Seconds to wait before killing the machine

Arguments.Name: move
Arguments.Description: Move an app to another organization

Arguments.Name: open
Arguments.Description: Open browser to current deployed application

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Show details about an organization's remote builder image

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Update an organization's remote builder image

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Remove a user from an organization

Arguments.Name: ping
Arguments.Description: Test connectivity with ICMP ping messages

Arguments.Name: --size
Arguments.Description: Size of probe to send (not including headers)

Arguments.Name: attach
Arguments.Description: Attach a postgres cluster to an app

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to an app config file or directory containing one

Arguments.Name: --database-name
Arguments.Description: Database to use, defaults to a new database with the same name as the app

Arguments.Name: --database-user
Arguments.Description: The database user to create, defaults to creating a user with the same name as the consuming app

Arguments.Name: --postgres-app
Arguments.Description: The postgres cluster to attach to the app

Arguments.Name: --variable-name
Arguments.Description: The env variable name that will be added to the app. Defaults to DATABASE_URL

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to an app config file or directory containing one

Arguments.Name: --database
Arguments.Description: The postgres database to connect to

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: The postgres user to connect with

Arguments.Name: --initial-cluster-size
Arguments.Description: The size of the initial postgres cluster

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: The name of the new app

Arguments.Name: --organization
Arguments.Description: The organization that will own the app

Arguments.Name: --password
Arguments.Description: The superuser password. one will be generated for you if you leave this blank

Arguments.Name: --region
Arguments.Description: The region to launch the new app in

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-id
Arguments.Description: Creates the volume with the contents of the snapshot

Arguments.Name: --volume-size
Arguments.Description: The size in GB for volumes

Arguments.Description: Delete a WireGuard token; token is name:<name> or token:<token>

Arguments.Name: start
Arguments.Description: Start a new WireGuard peer connection associated with a token (set FLY_WIREGUARD_TOKEN)

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Rekey a WireGuard peer connection associated with a token (set FLY_WIREGUARD_TOKEN)

Arguments.Name: websockets
Arguments.Description: Enable or disable WireGuard tunneling over WebSockets
